de.toman.milight

Class WiFiBox

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.toman.milight.WiFiBox

  • public class WiFiBox
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a MiLight WiFi box and is able to send commands to a particular box.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int COMMAND_ALL_OFF
      The command code for "RGBW COLOR LED ALL OFF".
      static int COMMAND_ALL_ON
      The command code for "RGBW COLOR LED ALL ON".
      static int COMMAND_ALL_WHITE
      The command code for "SET COLOR TO WHITE (GROUP ALL)".
      static int COMMAND_BRIGHTNESS
      The command code for "DIRECT BRIGHTNESS SETTING" (part of a two-byte command).
      static int COMMAND_COLOR
      The command code for "COLOR SETTING" (part of a two-byte command).
      static int COMMAND_DISCO
      The command code for "DISCO MODE".
      static int COMMAND_DISCO_FASTER
      The command code for "DISCO SPEED FASTER".

      The command code for "DISCO SPEED SLOWER".

      The command code for "GROUP 1 ALL OFF".

      The command code for "GROUP 1 ALL ON".

      The command code for "SET COLOR TO WHITE (GROUP 1)".
      static int COMMAND_GROUP_2_OFF
      The command code for "GROUP 2 ALL OFF".
      static int COMMAND_GROUP_2_ON
      The command code for "GROUP 2 ALL ON".
      static int COMMAND_GROUP_2_WHITE
      The command code for "SET COLOR TO WHITE (GROUP 2)".
      static int COMMAND_GROUP_3_OFF
      The command code for "GROUP 3 ALL OFF".
      static int COMMAND_GROUP_3_ON
      The command code for "GROUP 3 ALL ON".
      static int COMMAND_GROUP_3_WHITE
      The command code for "SET COLOR TO WHITE (GROUP 3)".
      static int COMMAND_GROUP_4_OFF
      The command code for "GROUP 4 ALL OFF".
      static int COMMAND_GROUP_4_ON
      The command code for "GROUP 4 ALL ON".
      static int COMMAND_GROUP_4_WHITE
      The command code for "SET COLOR TO WHITE (GROUP 4)".
      static int DEFAULT_PORT
      The default port for unconfigured boxes.
      static int MIN_SLEEP_BETWEEN_MESSAGES
      The sleep time between both messages for switching lights to the white mode.

        A constructor creating a new instance of the WiFi box class using the default port number.
        Parameters:

      • WiFiBox

        public WiFiBox(java.lang.String host,
               int port)
        throws java.net.UnknownHostException
        A constructor creating a new instance of the WiFi box class. The address is resolved from a hostname or ip address.
        Parameters:
        host - is the host given as hostname such as "domain.tld" or string repesentation of an ip address
        port - is the port of the WiFi box (omit this if unsure)
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException - if the hostname could not be resolved

      • WiFiBox

        public WiFiBox(java.lang.String host)
        throws java.net.UnknownHostException
        A constructor creating a new instance of the WiFi box class using the default port number. The address is resolved from a hostname or ip address.
        Parameters:
        host - is the host given as hostname such as "domain.tld" or string repesentation of an ip address
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException - if the hostname could not be resolved

    • Method Detail

      • getLights

        public Lights getLights(int group)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Get the group of lights that is controlled by a given group number. The Lights instance may be used to control the groups of lights individually and mix different WiFi boxes.
        Parameters:
        group - is the number of the group at the WiFi box (between 1 and 4)
        Returns:
        the group of lights that is controled by the given group number
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the group number is not between 1 and 4

      • off

        public void off()
         throws java.io.IOException
        Switch all lights off (all groups).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the message could not be sent

      • off

        public void off(int group)
         throws java.io.IOException,
                java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Switch all lights of a particular group off.
        Parameters:
        group - the group to switch of (between 1 and 4)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the message could not be sent
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the group number is not between 1 and 4

      • on

        public void on()
        throws java.io.IOException
        Switch all lights on (all groups).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the message could not be sent

      • on

        public void on(int group)
        throws java.io.IOException,
               java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Switch all lights of a particular group on.
        Parameters:
        group - the group to switch of (between 1 and 4)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the message could not be sent
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the group number is not between 1 and 4

      • white

        public void white()
        Switch all lights in all groups to the white mode. Note that the messages are sent in a new thread. Therefore, you should not send other commands directly after executing this one. Also, there are no exceptions when sending messages fails since they occur in another thread.

      • white

        public void white(int group)
           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Switch all lights in a particular group to the white mode. Note that the messages are sent in a new thread. Therefore, you should not send other commands directly after executing this one. Also, there are no exceptions when sending messages fails since they occur in another thread.
        Parameters:
        group - the group to switch of (between 1 and 4)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the group number is not between 1 and 4

      • discoMode

        public void discoMode()
               throws java.io.IOException
        Trigger the disco mode for the active group of lights (the last one that was switched on, see getActiveGroup()).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the message could not be sent

      • discoMode

        public void discoMode(int group)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Triggers the disco mode for a particular group of lights. The lights will be switched on before to activate them.Note that the messages are sent in a new thread. Therefore, you should not send other commands directly after executing this one. Also, there are no exceptions when sending messages fails since they occur in another thread.
        Parameters:
        group - the group to switch of (between 1 and 4)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the group number is not between 1 and 4

      • discoModeFaster

        public void discoModeFaster()
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Increase the disco mode's speed for the active group of lights (the last one that was switched on, see getActiveGroup()).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the message could not be sent

      • discoModeSlower

        public void discoModeSlower()
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Decrease the disco mode's speed for the active group of lights (the last one that was switched on, see getActiveGroup()).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the message could not be sent

      • brightness

        public void brightness(int value)
                throws java.io.IOException,
                       java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Set the brightness value for the currently active group of lights (the last one that was switched on, see getActiveGroup()).
        Parameters:
        value - is the brightness value to set (between MilightColor.MIN_BRIGHTNESS and MilightColor.MAX_BRIGHTNESS)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the message could not be sent
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the brightness value is not between MilightColor.MIN_BRIGHTNESS and MilightColor.MAX_BRIGHTNESS

      • brightness

        public void brightness(int group,
                       int value)
                throws java.io.IOException,
                       java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Set the brightness value for a given group of lights.
        Parameters:
        group - is the number of the group to set the brightness for
        value - is the brightness value to set (between MilightColor.MIN_BRIGHTNESS and MilightColor.MAX_BRIGHTNESS)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the message could not be sent
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if group is not between 1 and 4 or the brightness value is not between MilightColor.MIN_BRIGHTNESS and MilightColor.MAX_BRIGHTNESS

      • color

        public void color(int value)
           throws java.io.IOException,
                  java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Set the color value for the currently active group of lights (the last one that was switched on, see getActiveGroup()).
        Parameters:
        value - is the color value to set (between MilightColor.MIN_COLOR and MilightColor.MAX_COLOR)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the message could not be sent

      • color

        public void color(MilightColor color,
                  boolean forceColoredMode)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Set the color value for the currently active group of lights (the last one that was switched on, see getActiveGroup()).
        Parameters:
        color - is the color to set
        forceColoredMode - true if all colors should be displayed in colored mode, false to use white mode for colors with low saturation and else colored mode
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the message could not be sent

      • color

        public void color(MilightColor color)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Set the color value for the currently active group of lights (the last one that was switched on, see getActiveGroup()). Colors with low saturation will be displayed in white mode for a better result.
        Parameters:
        color - is the color to set
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the message could not be sent

      • color

        public void color(java.awt.Color color,

           throws java.io.IOException

        Parameters:
        color - is the color to set
        forceColoredMode - true if all colors should be displayed in colored mode, false to use white mode for colors with low saturation and else colored mode
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the message could not be sent

      • colorAndBrightness

        public void colorAndBrightness(MilightColor color)
        Set the color and brightness values for the currently active group of lights (the last one that was switched on, see getActiveGroup()). Both values are extracted from the color given to the function by transforming it to an HSB color.
        Parameters:
        color - is the color to extract hue and brightness from

      • colorAndBrightness

        public void colorAndBrightness(java.awt.Color color)
        Set the color and brightness values for the currently active group of lights (the last one that was switched on, see getActiveGroup()). Both values are extracted from the color given to the function by transforming it to an HSB color.
        Parameters:
        color - is the color to extract hue and brightness from

      • colorAndBrightness

        public void colorAndBrightness(int group,
                               MilightColor color,
                               boolean forceColoredMode)
        Set the color and brightness values for a given group of lights. Both values are extracted from the color given to the function by transforming it to an HSB color.
        Parameters:
        group - is the number of the group to set the color for
        color - is the color to extract hue and brightness from
        forceColoredMode - true if all colors should be displayed in colored mode, false to use white mode for colors with low saturation and else colored mode
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if group is not between 1 and 4

      • colorAndBrightness

        public void colorAndBrightness(int group,
                               MilightColor color)
        Set the color and brightness values for a given group of lights. Both values are extracted from the color given to the function by transforming it to an HSB color. Colors with low saturation will be displayed in white mode for a better result.
        Parameters:
        group - is the number of the group to set the color for
        color - is the color to extract hue and brightness from
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if group is not between 1 and 4

      • colorAndBrightness

        public void colorAndBrightness(int group,
                               java.awt.Color color,
                               boolean forceColoredMode)
        Set the color and brightness values for a given group of lights. Both values are extracted from the color given to the function by transforming it to an HSB color.
        Parameters:
        group - is the number of the group to set the color for
        color - is the color to extract hue and brightness from
        forceColoredMode - true if all colors should be displayed in colored mode, false to use white mode for colors with low saturation and else colored mode
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if group is not between 1 and 4

      • colorAndBrightness

        public void colorAndBrightness(int group,
                               java.awt.Color color)
        Set the color and brightness values for a given group of lights. Both values are extracted from the color given to the function by transforming it to an HSB color. Colors with low saturation will be displayed in white mode for a better result.
        Parameters:
        group - is the number of the group to set the color for
        color - is the color to extract hue and brightness from
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if group is not between 1 and 4

      • addLightListener

        public void addLightListener(int group,
                             LightListener listener)
        Use this function to add a new listener one group of lights connected to the WiFiBox. Listeners will be notified when the group of lights is switched on or off, color or brightness change, white or disco mode is activated or disco mode is set faster or slower.
        Parameters:
        group - is the number of the group to add the listener to
        listener - is the listener to add
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if group is not between 1 and 4

      • removeLightListener

        public void removeLightListener(int group,
                                LightListener listener)
        This function removes a listener from this WiFiBox which was added before by addLightListener(int, LightListener).
        Parameters:
        group - is the number of the group to remove the listener from
        listener - is the listener to remove
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if group is not between 1 and 4

      • getActiveGroup

        public int getActiveGroup()
        This function returns the number of the currently active group of lights.
        Returns:
        the number of the currently active group of lights

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        This function describes the objet as a string. Use this for debugging.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
